text: Tap at Tap House - Des Plaines. Deep brown with a thin tan ring. Dark chocolate, espresso, grapefruit and wood aromas. Fruity, dark chocolate restrained sweet flavor. Medium body with a soft feel.

Dark brown in color with a light tan head of foam. Light, smooth, and friendly bourbon character comprised of vanilla, sweet caramel, milk chocolate, and a slight dark fruit presence. Very smooth oatmeal malt makes this so decadent to sip on.
Deep brown color. Big vanilla oak, bourbon, sweet nose with a bit of chocolate. Lovely semi sweet mouth with bourbon, chocolate cake, oak. A bit thin body, warming bourbony finish. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Poured from bottle 2015 vintage Rate 1500 nice light chocolate color with a creamy mocha head. Aromas of oats chocolate coffee vanilla mild roasted malt. Taste is rich creamy perfectly balanced notes of chocolate coffee vanilla. Wow I could drink this every day.

(On tap @ CBC 2016 Red Session, Copenhagen) Pours dark brown to black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, moderately roasted malt, a little wood, quite some barrel character, sweet and creamy. Fairly sweet flavour as well, chocolate, toffee, sweet black coffee, vanilla, wood, slightly burnt, light bourbon, a bit creamy, hints of the oatmeal body, a little hint of booze. Finish has roasted malts, coffee, wood, semi-sweet chocolate, oatmeal, quite persistent. Medium bodied, oily and creamy, with soft carbonation. Does a good job drinking like its got a higher ABV, would be very easy to sip all evening.

Negra turva, espuma marrom de média formação e persistencia.
Bastante café e em segundo plano chocolate. 
Paladar de médio dulçor e leve amargor torrado.
Corpo cremoso e média carbonatação.
Final de base maltada, cereais que dão uma encorpada prazerosa, chocolate e amadeirado ficam mais intensos deixando o café em segundo plano.
Bottled:Black with ruby edges. Small head. Sweet aroma with Bourbon, fudge, char coal and licorice. Flavour is Bourbon, fudge and licorice leading to a warming finish.

Black colour, small beigeish brown head. Aroma is toffee, fudge, alcohol, some wood and mild toasted notes. Flavour is liquorice, fudge, some vanilla, mild toasted notes too.

Draught at City Beer (2015 vintage). Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, oak, bourbon, dark fruits, a bit of coffee, nuts, toffee and chocolate. Bitter finish with roasted malts, oak, bourbon, dark fruits, toffee, nuts, a bit of chocolate and vanilla. Exquisite stout.

Pitch black color, small and creamy beige head. Aromas of vanilla, chocolate, cream, mushrooms(?), coconut and wood. Complex taste of chocolate, cream, wood, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and slight spices. Well balanced and complex, but the hints of mushroom sauce is a bit weird.
@Basunen 17-3-25: Mycket trevlig doft med tydlig ton av ek och bourbon. Smaken är mycket len och kanske lite klen med toner av träd och lätta rostade toner. Lite i lättaste laget.

Bottle courtesy of fog dog. Cheers, Kevin! Pours a stout brown with a thicker than expected tan head. Nose is roast, earth, slight metal, sweet cocoa, some oak, mild vanilla, and a borderline smokes character. Flavor is similar- hits with earth, mold fruit, oak, slight chocolate-covered raisin, and some vanilla into the finish. Interesting beer with chocolate as very mild, vanilla in not as many places as Id think, and some fruity character that I did not expect.

Tap at A - bays in Waikoloa on the big island- very unexpected and nice surprise. Pour is near black with small ring of beige foam. Aroma is a nice mix of toasty malt and toffee bourbon. Maple and vanilla. Flavor very true to nose with a rich bourbon character but no alcohol heat. Really nice.

The aroma is quite subtle for a BBS, not as robust as I had hoped for. Pours like chocolate milk with a nice beige head. With an oily opaque tone, the flavor evenly breaks on the tongue. An unexpected fizziness gives way to a milky expresso, with a notes of orange peel. Its a bit thin in the middle, but Ill attribute that to the lower abv of comparable beers and results ina more drinkable OS. The bourbon oakiness is not overly boozy, but comes through on the backside of the finish. It reminds me of the xmas rum fruitcake I had as a kid. Overall a nicely balanced stout!

Bottle pour at PreFunk Nampa. Oily black pour, pretty much flat. Mild boozy aroma, big roast grains nose. Flavor really wraps it all up, silky smooth, gentle warmth, hints of chocolate and cocoa, coffee. Really nice 2015 vintage

This beer made my mid-afternoon. 2013 vintage at Rose & Crown in Palo Alto. Appearance was dark chocolate with a minimal light tan head. Aroma was strong coffee, chcolate, roasty grains with a hint of cream. 

Taste was incredibly well-balanced, with the immediate bitter sweetness of chocolate, backed by toasted grains and a little sprinkling of char. Subtle hints of dark fruit, but not too sweet - any sweetness came from an almost chocolate milk type flavor. Maybe even a little vanilla. Its the subtleties that make this beer - yes its a big bold stout, but very highly refined. Mothfeels is - dare I say - velvety? Not too think, but soft carbonation keeps it supple. 

10oz was plenty for me. Absolutely perfect for a cold, rainy day...which it was. Absolutely fantastic brew.
Bottle thanks to Joe. Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Rolled oats and chocolate milk. Light mouthfeel, slightly numbing.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Black body with a small offwhite head. Roasted malt, caramel, milk chocolate, oak, vanilla, sweet bourbon.

Sampled at the 2016 Czech Heritage Festival in a footed pilsener glass, an opaque dark brown colour, reddish at the edges, with sudsy beige foam, long-lasting with lace. Fantastic appearance. Malty, bready, toasty, roasty, with delicious notes of chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Definite bourbon and charred oak essence, but not so much as to overpower the other layers. Medium body, smooth and creamy mouthfeel from the oats, subtle tartness but not sour, aged but not oxidized, just plain masterfully made. I will definitely be seeking this out again and again.

22 oz bomber 2015 vintage. Pours a very dark brown with a one finger head. Aroma is barrel, vanilla, chocolate. Taste is barrel on the front of the palette with a milk chocolate note on the back of the palette. Mouthfeel is velvety, but a little thin. Overall, This is an excellent BA oatmeal stout that held up very well over the past two years. I will search it out again.
Shared 22 oz. bottle. 2016 edition. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, bourbon and oak. Taste is roasted malt, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coconut notes. Nice.

Aroma: lots of vanilla and bourbon; Appearance: pitch black with creamy tan head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: not too bourbony, smooth, roasty, a little chocolate; nice; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: quite good; would get again. Unusual to find a barrel aged regular stout.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Pours black oily color, opaque, with foamy light brown head. Aroma: roasted grain, dark malts , sherry-like bourbon note, vanillin, hint of molasses...flavor: intense roasted grain&dark malts, which takes on milk & bitter dark chocolate, espresso coffee. Theres a sherry-like boubon note, pretty well balanced with malt backbone. In the background are noticeable notes of vanillin, hint of wood...body is thick (low abv. but oat make bigger mouthfeel), texture velvetly, carbonation is low. Big stout for such a relatively low abv.
Pours a dark caramel-bourbon-brown with a light tan head. Caramel, chocolate, and cola on the nose. Viscous mouthfeel. Chocolate, nutty, caramel, and cola flavors.

Black in color with a sudsy off white head. Chocolate milk aroma. Super smooth and silky; light chocolate and roast character and light Bourbon booze touch. 

Notes: 2015 bottle from Eric opened in Jan 17
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. CBC #133 Jedno z większych rozczarowań CBC, wydawało się mocnawo wodniste :(

650ml bottle shared with brother. Aroma: light bacon, big milk chocolate, really subtle soapy / minty aroma. App: burgundy /brownish, small mocha head with yellow tint leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, a tad watery, smooth light sweet and bacon finish. Overall: lacks in body a bit surprisingly because of this high abv. Bourbon is not present enough for me.

On nitro. Pours black with brown head. A faint chocolate, coffee and roasted malt aroma. A creamy body of milk chocolate, light coffee, and some sweet and roasted malts. A lingering chocolate aftertaste.
Pours nearly black with a tan head. Aromas of coffee and vanilla along with a creamy taste.

Bottle (2016 Vintage); pours nearly black with a tan head; aroma of vanilla, wood, and chocolate with a hint of coffee and bourbon; taste has a light sweetness to it with chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, a bit coffee and wood; finish is dry and roasty with a hint of bourbon; very nice

2014 vintage, aged two years. Pours a deep brown, with ample tan head. Aroma is a bit musty, with hints of chocolate and wood. Taste is smooth and rich, notes of chocolate and coffee, with a bit of vanilla. Very good blend and complexity. Thumbs way up on this one....

Thanks to Boisebeerguy!!!!
Nice bottle with a lot of information, black beer with short beige head, smell is bourbon and for me red wine, taste coffee, dark chocolate and bourbon, good balance between sweet and bitter, full body, oily, flat carbonation, finish is bourbon, very good, 
(I have 0.65l bottle version 2015)

Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, leather, roasted malts. Taste of bourbon, chocolate, earthy coffee, butterscotch, short lasting finish. Quite light mouthfeel, but very easy drinking beer. Straight forward, balanced, well made.

Taps barely translucent caramel with a decent buff head. Aroma presents a sharp alcohol note like cognac or some other strong liquor, followed by roast malt, woody and nutty notes. Flavor continues the sharp alcohol but ups the malt, woody and nutty tones while adding a bit of chocolate. Mouthfeel delivers fair body but strong, sassy fizz. Get velvety.

A bottle on Black Christmas 2016 at 12 Kings. Vintage 2016. Pours a very dark reddish brown with no head. Aroma is bourbon, roasted seeds, chocolate. Taste is pretty the same with moderate sweetness. Very smooth. Good stuff.
On tap at Pinocchios. My fifth bourbon beer, so whatever. Bourbon on the nose and tongue. Not overpowering, oatmeal discernible under it all. Thick and chewy. Tasty.

Ok, stop laughing, clowns. To set the record straight, I have ticked this many times. The first time was in the first dark age, before I discovered legit beer ticking (pre-2008). The second and other subsequent times were in the second dark age of 2012-15 when I was ticking beers but not rating them on here, a disgraceful era Id rather not talk about. If you want to learn more, Shia LaBeouf plays me in "Tickiana Jones and The Legend of the Lost Ticks" (yes, he did win the Best On-Screen Ticking Performance an Oscar for it). Well here I am, merking the Merkin once more, but this time, legitimately recording the moment. Boxed bomber poured into a Lost Abbey glass (not a comment on the carbonation; this has some carbonation, a.k.a. infinitely more than most vintages of Angels Share). The beer pours darkest brown with a thin tan head that fades to a ring. Now I have put my nose into many merkins in my day, most with a quite foul odor, but this was much more pleasant. Nice bourbon and oak notes, balanced by dark chocolate, light roast, caramel, and molasses. The flavor has a touch of chocolate/caramel sweetness that yields to a dry finish with some bourbony heat. The feel is quite light with soft carbonation, a little hot. So there it is. You happy now?

From 22oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a dark brown-black color, thin tan head. Nose is huge coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit, slight vanilla. Taste is sweet with touches of sourness, medium-heavy bodied. Finishes extremely smooth. Phenomenal beer, that complexity is hard to beat.
On tap at Eureka, Mountain View. Rich Bourbon vanilla and oak aroma. Taste is really good. Grainy, vanilla, coffee. Really good.

Given to me by grandson Nick and consumed at Thanksgiving dinner when he was here. . Pours black, with beige head. Thick, lacing. Nose is dark ripe fruit including raisins, cherry. vanilla and bourbon. Full body. Flavor is like the aroma with lots of chocolate. Finishes super smooth Simply outstanding.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Zeer mooi, vanille, bourbon, vanille, toffee met lichte koffiezweem. Zeer mooie afdronk.
Pours black, small grey head. Smell is sweet, thick, bourbon. Taste is full, Sharp , bit bitter. Very full on bourbon. Very Nice, and easy drinkable.

Bottled. 2015 vintage. Pours black, beige/Grey head. Aroma is bourbon barrel notes, slightly oxidized, dark fruit, cherries, chocolate, vanilla, toffee, semi leathery. Flavor is bourbon, chocolate, dark fruit, toffee, oats, lactose. Really nice. Mouthfeel is smooth. Excellent.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a black color with off white head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, caramel, nuts, coffee. Taste is moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Very smooth creamy mouthfeel. Flavors of cocoa, vanilla, wood, bourbon, some plum, caramel, toffee, coffee. Very smooth easy drinking BA stout. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep brown with just a bit coffee colored foam. Nose is espresso, vanilla and bourbon. Taste is coffee, chocolate, toasted oats, and a hint of bourbon. Well carbonated and disappointingly not creamy. Its not very sweet which is nice but the texture is a bummer. All in all pretty good though.

2013 bottle. Shiny black with a thick, low head. Nose is vanilla, coconuts, hazelnuts, plums, minerals. Sweet and smooth with tons of hazelnuts, lots of chocolate, some vanilla, coconut, and a touch of whiskey. Really not all that much whiskey, but the additives take over. This was decent, but a disappointment compared to other BA beers from them. Too cloying and ruled by the additives.

Tap into a snifter showing pitch black with a finger of latte foam. 

The nose shows a lot of spicy alcoholic bourbon. No malt character at all. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Flavors of strong bourbon with a light dark chocolate note in the middle. Strong alcoholic spice that comes across like sweet cinnamon. No bitterness as theres a lot of bourbon. Not bad but not great; too much bourbon and barely any stout.

2016 22oz bomber. Pours a dark hazelnut brown with a foamy and quickly dissipating head. Even lacing. Smells of frssh roasted hazelnut, chocolate frosting, and rye bread with oaky bourbon im the background. Tastes like sweet nutella, peppery alcohol notes in the middle with bitter chocolate. Watery mouthfeel with light body, delicate carbonation, but a longlasting finish of bitter chocolate.
From tap at CBC 2016. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of vanilla, oak, chocolate, coffee, spice, dried fruit, caramel, bourbon and bitterness.
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla and riped fruits with oaky notes. Starts sweet but finish bitter with lingering bourbon notes. A good one.

Un stout. Un grand stout! Le liquide est ambré, brun, presque sombre sans toutefois lêtre complètement. Une timide mousse. De grandes aspirations. Des arômes vanillés, torréfiés, dalcool léger des îles. La Signature de la Maison est palpable malgré que cette bière est bien différente de ses consoeurs. Corps mince - normal pour un stout - caramel, bourbon léger, rhum and Coke. Vraiment une bière rhum and Coke! Pétillante, mince et chargée de caramels et de sucres résiduels. Un magnifique impérial stout à petite échelle.

(Firestone Walker Velvet Merkin) Bottle 650ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8.5% (vintage 2015).
Black coloured body with a small but thick tan head, with pretty good retention.
Arom ahas lots of bourbon, vanilla, some chocolate underneath although the truth is that the bourbon dominates everything else.
The taste is more commple on the other hand, still lots of bourbon upfront but also obvious chocolate now, vanilla, coconut, light wood, mocca, the bourbon compliments it perfectly.
Medium body with good carbonation, slightly sticky on the palate.
Very good!

2104 poured in a snifter. Black with an average tan head that leaves decent lacing as it shrinks. Aroma is oak, vanilla, oats, chocolate, and slight bourbon. Taste is oats, oak, bourbon, cocoa, and vanilla. Average mouthfeel and a light linger. Good beer.
Draft. A black beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, raisins, and bourbon. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, alcohol, and raisins, leading to a dry finish.

CBC 2016 Red session. Black body with a tiny offwhite head. aroma of douch, chocolate, rye and spices. Taste is roasty, chocolate and vanilla, with a sweet fruit note. Oak and bourbon finish with a strong and delightful coffee anftertaste.

2014 vintage...clearing out the cellar. Boxed bomber purchased in October 2014 at BevMo in Escondido ($17.49). POURS a dark brown with two finger of fizzy tan-brown foam, soon receding. AROMA of fresh roasted dark coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, toasted coconut, boozy thick bourbon, and caramel. FLAVOR of smooth dark chocolate, bourbon-drizzled toffee, cafe au lait, nutty roasted malts, and vanilla toffee. Roasty with hints of burnt, but subdued on the sweetness. Drinks amazingy smooth thanks to the oatmeal and the well-concealed ABV. Very good, though I might have liked the bourbon and oak to be more pronounced. (458, 1036)

DLD taster. Another solid offering from FW. No doubt, one of the finest oatmeal stouts anywhere... Love this beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ CBC-16. Dark brown with a tiny tan head. Malty and vanilla tones. Malt, wood, fruit, vanilla and hops. Medium to full body with a balanced bitter sweet finish.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Red session, København
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla and cocoa. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla and cocoa finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Red session 20160514. Roasted malty and caramely with bourbon, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted and sweet with alcoholic notes.
This has got to be the one of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Dark, smooth, thick and to die for!

Bottle shared with koleminer20, oh yes. Aroma is oatmeal, chocolate, bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, coffee, sweet, really good. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, poured slightly thin. Taste is oatmeal, chocolate, marshmallow, barrel, bourbon, coffee, roasted malt, delicious. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, delicious oatmeal, chocolate aftertaste. Overall, a lovely lovely beer.

CBC16, red session, tap. Near black with a light tan head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted, red berries, barre, vanilla). Flavor medium+ sweet, fruity, barrel, some alcohol. Almost full body, smooth.
Sample at CBC 2016. Creamy smell and taste with chocolate and bourbon. Similar taste with milk chocolate. Dark malts but not very roasted. Creamy smooth mouthfeel.
Pours black. Aroma is roasted, creamy. Taste is smooth, very creamy, roasted, nutty.
Tap @CBC16. Clear dark brown, small beige head. Soft barrel aroma, malt and bourbon. Malty flavour, dark sugar and light bourbon booze. Some licorice perhaps. Decent.

duft:fed ristet kakao kokus 
smag chokolade ristet malt bitter rund og fed smag
Sample CBC-16, Copenhagen 14/5-16. Roasted malty with bourbon and some vanilla nd oats. Dry finish with bourbon.
Sample @ CBC 2016. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with vanilla, chocolate and some coffee and Bourbon. Dry finish

Tap at CBC 2016, Red session. Poured almost black with a round bubbly light tan head. The aroma is. Roasty malt, rich red berry fruit, some yeast, light roasty malts. The flavour is moderate sweet with a big smooth alcoholic bitter, rich fruit palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at cbc. Pours hazy brown black with a off white head. Aroma of vanilla, caramel, wood, ba, coffee, light choko. Taste is rather sweet loads if ba and vanilla hints if roast and coffee. Quite watery palate. Very enjoyable

From tap at CBC 2016. It pours opaque black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is ripe fruity with some roasted malty notes. Vanilla and oat. Chocolate and sweet roasted flavor with vanilla and chocolate notes.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Chocolate, bread, coffee and roasted malts. Very nice.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Pours dark brown with a thin off white head. Plummy, caramelly, mild spicy aroma. Flavor has sweetness, bread, plums, hops. Sweet warming finish.
22 oz bottle. Black with a decent tan head. Aroma is of oak, vanilla, whiskey, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is of whiskey, oak, vanilla, chocolate, smooth, and sweet.
Bottle. The look is dark, black dark colored. The smell is whiskey, wood, malt, sweet, alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, goodness, chocolate, and good. The taste is sweet, malt, cocoa, alcohol, wood, good.

2013 version on tap @ Brouwers. Pours inky watery blackish brown with medium mocha head that fades quickly. Aroma is dry lightly roasty dark chocolate malt, heavily oaky mid-palate, lightly boozy on the finish. Taste is smooth creamy oatmeal malt, rich milk chocolate, light bourbon and barrel notes. Obviously not as big as most of the other FW barrel-aged offerings, still has plenty of flavor. Though clearly a smaller beer than Parabola or the barleywines.

Thanks to Bytemesis, this bottle poured dark brown with crimson hues, a small off-white head and nice lacing. Aromas of roasted malt, caramel, cocoa, and bourbon. Flavor is silky smooth chocolate with a hint of booze. Awesome!

Pours a near pitch black with the slightest hints of a reddish hue. Small but stubborn head of off white foam. Very nice lacing. 

The Bourbon dominates the smell with smaller doses of roasted malt and oats. 

Oats and bourbon share top billing in the taste. Roasted malt, chocolate of the milky kind round it out. Finishes decidedly with that oaty goodness. 

Full bodied with medium carbonation. 

Delicious! Thanks Jay! !

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Review from memory - sampled at a tasting a year ago. Chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, some caramel and roasted malts, smooth mouthfeel - another excellent beer from Firestone. 4.3/5 (13.03.2016)
16.01.2017: bottle at home. Clear dark mahogany pour with a medium height tan head with decent retention. Notes of bourbon, roasted malts, vanilla, toasted coconut, caramel, dark cherries, a bit of chocolate and coffee. Medium body, smooth texture. It eels a bit light at times, but for its relatively low ABV (for a barrel-aged stout, that is) it more than delivers.

July 18, 2015. Bottle, 2013 vintage. 
Dark brown, almost black with a minimal brown head. Aroma is chocolate, toffee, coffee, berries, oak and bourbon. Taste is light to medium sweet, soft bitter. Finish is a bit watery, light to medium sweetness with berries, toffee, vanilla, light bitter cocoa and some bourbon hints. Light bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Good but thin.

0,65l bottle at Vienna Tasting from trade with amzngwrldfood, big thanks. Vintage 2015, almost black color, small tan head. smells of coconut, dried fruits, some wood, light roast, some bitter chocolate, great smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of sherry, some coconut, coffee, licorice, light alcohol, spices, wood, liqueurish. finishes lightly medical with some roast and notes of coconut, vanilla and some licorice. great stuff.

Bottle at Vienna tasting February 2016. Many thanks! Clear dark brown colour. This one definitely deserves every point it gets. Really rich and tasty, kind of resemblant to Jack Daniels with the coconut and similar warming finish. But also subtle roasted notes remain, making for a wonderful and memorable experience.

Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister. Many thanks! Pours pitch black with quickly disappearing tan head. Aroma of vanilla, light coffee, chocolate and roasted Malts. Light fruitiness. Creamy, velvet smooth taste with layers of chocolate, Barrel notes like bourbon and oak, coffee, vanilla and coconut. sweetish alcohol lightly warning alcohol finish. Quite excellent.

Bottle kindly shared by Werckmeister, many thanks. Very dark brown color with medium beige head. Coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon in aroma. Chocolate, roasted malt, espresso, hazelnuts. Warming alcohol. Tasty.

What a great beer! Its as complex as they come, with smells of chocolate and especially coffee mixing with a distinct bourbon bite and sweetness. The oatmeal is kept way back in the far background, and its thinned out a bit from its time spent in the barrel. Overall, its a delicious, complex, fantastic beer.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares #whoknowshowmany. Thanks for this Zakoon. Pours black with a small offwhite head. Aromas of bourbon, light smoke, dark chocolate, malt. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, malt, tobacco.

On tap at MTG smooth chocolate taste
With a hint of vanilla and coffee. The bourban flavor is not overpowering. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wonderful. Black and creamy with a huge brown foamy head. Nice lacing. Smooth and oily. Roasted malt, dark toast, vanilla and chocolate with an underlayment of bourbon.

Infected. Dark black pour with an uncharacteristically profuse head. Very spritzy and overly carbonated. No body and almost no flavor. Aroma is muted. Infection takes over and makes this tough to drink. Fizzy with no flavor. Bleh.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17. Thanks to Klimaet. Pours almost black with a beige head. Aroma of oatmeal, coffee, bourbon, dark roasted malts and some chocolate. The taste is sweet and standard impy forward with notes of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, oatmeal and some weak bourbon notes.
Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17. Weak blackish pour with a light tan head. Notes of cocoa pops, vanilla, chocolate, light roast and some bourbon. Smooth!

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Clear half-pint glass
From: Firestone Barrelworks in Buellton, Calif.
Price: $16.99
Purchased: July 28, 2015
Consumed: Dec. 29, 2015
Misc.: 2014 vintage

Poured a black color with 2-to-3 fingers of rocky, tan head. Above average amount of spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled a big whiff of boozy bourbon up front, followed by toffee, caramel, milk chocolate, light espresso, oaky vanilla, oatmeal, faint dates and even some maple syrup. (Smell - 4.25)

Taste was pretty good, but nowhere as flavorful as I thought it would be. Especially after having another BCBS earlier in the day. Got smooth bourbon, chocolate, faint crayon, toffee, caramel, light oaky vanilla, tobacco, dry oatmeal, faint roasty malts and faint rye bread. Seemed to be missing something. Disappointing. (Taste - 3.75) 

Full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. (Feel - 4.50)

I was expecting so much more in this one. Good, but nowhere near their anniversary beers, Sucaba, Parabola, etc. I probably overrated it a tad. (Overall - 4.000 

4.01 90 A-

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #17. Pours a dark, reddish brown with a big, light tan head. Aroma has lots of chocolate, choco pop crunchers, dark malts, dark dried fruits, slight hops. Taste is sweet, milk chocolate, bourbon, slight watery roasty bitter finish. Medium low carb and a medium full body.

On tap. Served in tulip glass. One finger head slowly thins and remains a while. head is medium tan. Some light lacing.Beer is extremly dark black. Aroma is light but good creamy subtle malts. Taste is creamy smooth roasted malts. Medium sweet, very little bitterness. Light notes of vanilla. Medium bodied beer with light carbonation. Overall awesome beer. Truly velvet on the tungu. Unbelievablely smooth. Well balanced.
Tap at barrelworks, buellton. Black color, tanned head. Aroma has roasted malts and coffee. Balanced roasty body, chocolate, hint of vanilla and coffee.
Aroma of caramel and vanilla. Very smooth easy to drink. Some chocolate and vanilla notes at the finish. Pretty sweet. Not as good as he hype. Maybe it needs to age

Appearance: Dark black cola

Pitch black imperial stout. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, smoke. Taste is oak, smoke and vanilla with chocolate notes. Exceptionally dry finish. Licorice, Would age very well. My personal preference would be a little more sweetness, but its an exceptional beer.

650 ml bottle. 2015 vintage. Pours a dark brown with moderate head that settles quickly. Aromas of cheap bourbon, oatmeal cookies, and walnuts. Flavors follow same with oak and quite a bit of alcohol for the ABV. Thin. Really expecting more...

650ml bottle @ Churchills Pub & Grille, San Marcos, CA 

Pours pitch black with a bubbly head. Aroma of roasty malts, milky coffee, vanilla, hints of oak and wood. Taste is smooth, sweetish and slightly roasty with some coffee, vanilla and oak. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and oaky with some milky coffee, vanilla and toffee. Tasty.

65 cl bottle (2014 vintage) @ Churchills Pub & Grille.

August 28, 2015 - bottle via trade. Black pour with some head. Aroma was chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and some oats/grain. Taste started with the sweetness from the chocolate and vanilla, moved into a mild bourbon and finished with a cocoa powder. 2013 vintage.

Rating # 2000. Bottle (2013) from IP trade with richiesd (thanks!), shared with Simon and some more @ In De Wildeman. Dark brown color, as good as opaque. Light beige head, not very long retention. Alcoholfeel is rather strong, somewhat burning. Finishes with chocolate, sweetness. Not as mindblowing as Sucaba or Parabola, but nice nonetheless.

Overall this beer just doesnt live up to the hype for me. Can taste the bourbon barrel aging, but it is just too watery and weak. Overall not that great for me, and definitely not worth the price in my book.
2013 bottle. Deep brown with just a touch of foam. Brown sugar, vanilla, and bourbon aromas are mirrored in the taste. Great aftertaste. Leaves a little burn to remember it by.
Bottle. Pours a very dark brown. Aroma and taste are chocolate, bourbon, and some vanilla.

For such a strong flavor, it drinks very light and smooth, might be nicer if it was a little fuller but hard to say, still excellent. Can taste the coconut as well-though I probably wouldn?t pick that out if it wasn?t in the description. Delicious.

Bottle. 2014 vintage. Black pour with a tall, frothy brown head. Aroma is slightly boozy with roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, vanilla and light coconut. Taste is chocolate covered cherries, roasted malt, burnt caramel, vanilla, light coconut, booze notes and dark bittersweet chocolate. Body is medium-full with a moderate, bubbly carbonation. Slightly sticky and mildly warming as well. Ends with more vanilla, chocolate covered cherries, roasted malt, light coffee and burnt caramel notes. Tasty!
tried at recent bottle share. this is a perfect example of the style, like mostly everything they do.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a nearly pitch black color with a thick and creamy tan colored head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, slowly fading and leaving behind a sticky looking lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma is big of a sweet oatmeal smell with a good showing of a woody and bourbon boozy smell. Along with these aromas comes smells of caramel and vanilla as well as a little bit of a more toasted malt and somewhat grainy smell giving a very nice warningly dark and sweet smell
 Taste- The taste begins with a big sweet oatmeal flavor with a good and heavy flavor of oats and caramel as well as a bit of vanilla and some nice woody and bourbon flavors upfront. There is a decent showing of a more roasted and chocolate flavor upfront, but these pale in comparison to the sweeter oat. As the taste advances the woody flavors lessen a bit, but the sweeter flavors grow even more intense with quite a bit more vanilla and caramel coming to the tongue. All the while the more roasted flavors really start picking up steam more toward the end surpassing the oat flavor of the brew. While at 8.5 % abv., the alcohol is very well concealed and with the mix of flavors that is left at the end, a nice roasted and sweet, lightly woody and moderately oatmeal like flavor is left to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel-The body of the beer is on the thinner side for a oatmeal stout of 8.5% abv with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. A thicker body and lower carbonation would have been much better for the oatmeal and sweeter roasted flavors of the brew, really giving support to these rich flavors.

 Overall- A rather tasty oatmeal stout overall with a nice hit of woody bourbon flavor without a whole lot of heavy and hot booziness. A nice, oatmeal, semi-sweet roasty brew.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2014 Bottle 22oz $14): Black with small head. Lightly carbonated. bourbon and coffe smell. Dark chocolate taste and a little boozy. Medium plus body. Very nice. Need to find more.

Update: was rated 4.2

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, vanilla, dark sweet fruity. Taste is sweet and light bitter, roasted malty, sweet dark chocolate, some coffee and vanilla, light wood. Body is medium, silky oily with soft carbonation.

Poured a near pitch black color, ruby notes on the edges of the glass. Aroma was roasted malt, dark chocolate, some vanilla and toasted coconut. Flavor was boozy bourbon, with notes of vanilla and some toasted coconut. Bold.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2014 22 oz bottle of 2013 vintage from my cellar. Oh, wow! Aroma is sweet, woody, and boozy, with hints of raisin, toffee, leather, and rum. Mouthfeel starts sweet, finishes sweet and quite bitter, and has an alcoholic burn in the aftertaste. I don?t usually go wild over barrel-aged beers, but this one is fantastic!

2013 vintage. Poured from a 22. First aroma was very boozy, it reminded me of the rum neat I was poured the night before. As the beer warmed it brought on a woody aroma. First sip was surprisingly smooth and not at all boozy. The flavors were a perfect combination of wood, roasty, astringent, caramel and dark chocolate. The finish is slightly too carbonated for me.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle. It pours black with a very short lived head. Beautiful nose full of sweet chocolate, light bourbon, vanilla and wood. I was shocked at how thin this was on the tongue. I was expecting something motor oil like and instead was greated with a light to medium bodied beer. Nice job extracting a high amount of flavor given the body. Nice chocolate covered coconut, berries, and mocha notes. Great brew.

2014 bottle. My favorite stout for a couple years. Smells instantly of pear & cherry with a touch of vanilla. Flavor is milkshakey with light vanilla throughout and bourbon flambeed banana with caramel and a lingering vanilla taste. Excellent!!!

22 oz. bottle got in an extra in a trade with BOLTZ7555, thanks Jason. Vintage is 2013. Aroma is light bourbon up front, oatmeal, chocolate malt and more of a rye whiskey rather than mellow bourbon. 
The flavor is rather good. The same as the nose. Dont let me sound negative here but the body is much thinner than I would have expected for a barrel aged Oatmeal stout. I love the flavor but the body is lightly lacking. I would be stoked if I could brew a BBA stout this good. Perhaps my expectations were a tad high.
Black pour. Small tan head. Little lacing. Coffee aroma with chocolate. Taste of chocolate. Not bad.

Ohmygawd! Was hoping, but not expecting this to be on par with Parabola, a much bigger beer. I was a little worried this would be thin, as it is well under 9% - far less than any other FW barrel project beer. Silly me. The aroma is a tapestry of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and wood. No trace of alcohol. It looks and feels like liquid silk, the abv actually preferred over the 13%ers. Flavor nearly matches the aroma and adds a graham cracker.smores complexity. Faaaantasic beer. Cant wait to have it again. What a treat!"
Tap at CBC 2014. Deep black in the glass, small head. Mild malty aroma. Starts strong-malty, earthy, notes of strong coffee. Some wood. Well balanced finish. Quite drinkable. Nice!
Blindprovad flaska (signerad). Härlig och balanserad är första intryck. Fyllig. Fett som fasen naturligtvis. Lagom spritig. Härlig raritetsnivå, speciellt med tanke på signaturen.

2013 from a recent trade. These guys just make some ridiculous beer. Chocolate and coffee and a light coconut flavor. Sweet milk chocolate finish. Vanilla from some bourbon barrel. A complex but smooth and subtle drink. The oatmeal and chewy grain from the Merlin gets chilled out and smoothed out in this one.

22 oz bottle, 2013 vintage, batch #001, 1500 milestone review- Pours black with a little red highlight when held up to the light and a nice light tan one finger head that for the most part sticks around for the duration. Aroma is strong in toasted coconut, bourbon, coffee cake, chocolate, and vanilla, classic Firestone Walker. The taste is similar, toasted coconut and bourbon hit the senses first, the bourbon is slightly more subtle in the taste, then the vanilla, coffee and chocolate hit you, it is masterfully blended, wonderfully complex. There is a underlying dark fruit character that i only detected after i swallowed, very interesting, it almost gives it a little tartness, the oatmeal adds a mellowing creaminess as well, loved it. This beer makes it obvious why when in need of a milestone beer FW is the go to brewery!

5/VII/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBSG III (Gent) - BB: n/a (2014-736) Thanks to omgrich for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, big aery beige irregular head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: some chlorine, caramel, vanilla, cocoa powder, bit sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sweet, caramel, vanilla, some alcohol, bitter hops, bit of mocha, chlorine touch, sugary, milk chocolate. Aftertaste: little bitter, lots of chocolate, bit sour, mocha, some coffee, vanilla, bit malty, cookie dough, bit of chlorine still.

Bottle thanks to Santa! Pours black with a creamy brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has roasted malts with a bit of coconut and a touch of vanilla and dark grains. Flavor has more of a dark grain and vanilla combo with some smooth sweet dark grains and a bit of barrel and some coconut.

Bomber from Whole Foods Charlottesville, 2013 vintage, on 5/24/14. Pours a dark brown color with a thin brown head. Good head retention. Aroma of roast, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, mild wood and hops. The taste is roasted malts, dark fruits, chocolate, bourbon, wood, vanilla, mild hops. Medium bodied, low carbonation, slight lingering tartness, smooth, good balance. Nice beer.

Poured opaque black with a 1-finger dark tan head. Moderate amount of bubbling along the wall of the glass. Aroma of dark-roasted coffee mixed with caramel, bourbon and woody vanilla. Full body, very slightly oily. A touch of heat from the bourbon in the finish, and a nice softness from the oatmeal. Flavor of dark coffee with a woody note in the finish. A touch of caramel from the bourbon underneath. Some notes of plum as well. Excellent.

Sample @ RBWG Asheville After Party. Deep brown with a small head. Chocolate, chimney flue, dark roasted malt. Robust caramel and toffee. More chocolate. Smooth, supple and rich. No sharp edges. A great sipper.

22 oz bottle. The pour is a great black color with a cocoa colored head that fades down leaving no real lace. The aroma is just beautiful! It's got an awesome oatmeal and roasted malt characters. The barrel adds beautiful vanilla, marshmallow and bourbon notes. The flavor is just the same. It's a little light, but the characters are all present. The mouth feel is great, with a beautiful carbonation. The aftertaste is chocolatey, lingering and awesome for a barrel beer. I love it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, blue session. 02/05/2014. Dark black in colour,oily, no head. Aroma is earthy wood, with some caramel + toffee, hot alcohol. Flavour is smooth dark choc, figs and raisin and dried fruits. Very full in flavour. Paalte is full and smooth on the tongue with chalky mineral.

Draught at CBC 2014. Opaque black liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, wood and vanilla. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of chocolate and wood. Full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

Draught @ CBC 2014 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Firestone Walker Velvet Merkin ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, dark cherry - berries, vanilla -chocolate and coconut, light hoppy. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, roasted, dark malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140502]

Bottle from Justin, thanks!
Black/brown with a light beige head.
Aroma has bourbon, raisins, dark chocolate and roasted malt.
Taste has Bourbon, coffee, roasted malt, some tart notes, vanilla and chocolate.
Thin to medium body, soft carbonation.
Warming bourbony after taste.
Much to thin for my taste.

Bottle, from Brewery. Reserve series 001, 2013. Real good aroma, sweet. A
OT going on. Chocolate, cherry,
 Vanilla, coconut. Dark orangey brownish black color. Good head and lace. Sweet flavor. Light body , creamy smooth mouthfeel, sweet dry finish. WOW. Thats crazy good. Aroma, stronger on barrel, but not overwhelmingly so, flavor, my favorite part, is a wonderful blend of the Porter and the barrel, no surprise coming from FW. Winner.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Bottle at RBSG 2014. Thx to everyone for sharing todays bottles!
APPEARANCE: clear black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: bourbon, caramel, sweet.
TASTE: bourbon, caramel, sweet.
Bottle @ RBBSG 2014. Thanks omgrich! Black colour, dark brown foam. Soft carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts with lots of cocoa, vanilla and bourbon. Well balanced but a bit too much sweetness.

650 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG III. Thanks to omgrich! Black, thick mocha. Sweet thick mocha, milk chocolate, dark grapes, brown chocolate, lovely touch of bourbon, not in your face but definitely there, sweet coffee. Rich, decadent. Another stellar Firestone brew, yowza.

Pours a super dark dark mahogany with a pretty tan head. The smell is coconut, vanilla, , bourbon, chocolate. The taste is rich milk chocolate, bourbon, fruit. Medium body and soft texture with fine carbonation.
Bottle, 2013. Pours caramel-tinged chestnut. Aroma is powerful caramel, prunes, bourbon, honey, complex malts. Taste is surprisingly balanced maple, bourbon, cocoa, pecans. Very drinkable. Excellent.

Bomber courtesy of WanderinCelt87 that he sent a while back, thanks! Pours black with a thick brown head and lots of lacing in the glass, looks very nice, aroma is sweet, but not grossly sweet, nice amount of roast and vanilla with a little bit of bourbon and oak, flavor has a roasty front end with lots of vanilla and chocolate with a finish of bourbon and coffee mixed together, the barrel is pretty subtle but still works really well, Im not a fan of coconut, but I cant get a ton of it anyways, really enjoyable. Anyone have an extra bottle they want to send me?

Draft at Kite & Key. Pours a cola brown, near black with no head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, coffee, roast. Taste follows with additional notes of dark fruit, coconut and marshmallow. The overwhelming bourbon aroma is not as dominant in the flavor. Well balanced with a lot going on. Mouthfeel is a slightly oily and it is pretty full bodied. Very solid
Aromas of fudgey chocolate pudding, toasty nuttiness. Black with a somewhat lasting off-white head. Off-dry, chocolatey. Full bodied, very smooth.
Aroma of milk chocolate, sweeter, little toasted. Very smooth. Bittersweet chocolate, nutty, nuances of bourbon.
Malty belgian chocolate aroma. Light brown head and very dark body. Flavors of chocolate and minor berry. Smooth on the palate
CBC. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, dark chocolate and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. 020514
On tap at CBC 2014. Black with tan head. Aroma and taste has liquorice, roasted notes, bourbon, wood, barrel, lightly roasted notes, cocoa and a small hint of vanilla.

Bought at FW October 2013 & poured into a FW snifter black with a tan head. Aroma is coffee bourbon cherry cocoa with slight coconut.
Flavor is chocolate coffee with subtle vanilla cherry. Coconut prominent & incredibly smooth. Easily sipped & savored. Certainly an exceptional Oak Barrel aged brew.

Poured from a bottle obtained from the brewery October 2013. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon. Appearance is black like old engine oil with a one finger tan head that slowly dissipates. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, some coffee, prune, coconut, vanilla. Palate is good with great carbonation. if you have never had this I urge you to seek out a bottle. Cheers.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours nearly clear and deep brown with a small, fat-bubbled, taupe head. The bouquet is a rich, lush blend of vanilla, caramel, coconut and toasted tree nuts. Full-bodied and velvety-smooth with sufficient carbonation. Malty goodness and mild bourbon heat hits and sticks in the smooth, malty flavor and lengthy, seamless, soul-warming finish. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!
Draught at CBC 2014. Black - offwhite head. Chocolate, ok burned, coconut, vanilla, licorice, ryebread, dired fruits, cherry, bourbon, nice mellow bourbon, coffee, oakay. Lovely smooth.

On tap 2012 vintage. Pours a brownish black color with a thick tan head that leaves great lacing. Smells of oats, chocolate, vanilla, oak and roasted malt. Tasted of the same things with a little coconut there too. Mouthfeel is thick silky and creamy with great carbonation for a barrel aged beer. Wow Firestone Walker hit one out of the park again.

22oz bottle in a teku. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon and oak, dark chocolate and coffee, hints of dark fruits, and light notes of vanilla. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the bourbon and stout. Smooth texture. A really good beer.

Bottle form Thom, thanks buddy! Black pour, not overly thick, tan mocha head. Aroma, lots of oak, roasted malts, vanilla, and coffee. Taste, a bit thin on the mouthfeel, some oak and vanilla from the barrel up front but not a bourbon bomb, followed by roasted malts, and a clean bitter finish. Overall, really good, lots of oatmeal stout in the flavour from the base beer and the barrel treatment adds some nice complexity, its a bit thin but its also the most sessionable beer Ive had from their barrel aged series.

Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours a dark amber brown black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty woody chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty woody chocolate finish with weak hints of vanilla.
draft at Blue Monk, medium bodied black pour, complex. chcolate, bourbon, vanilla, coconut. flavors melded well together nicely. great beer

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 2nd Session. Pours brown with a beige head, aroma of honey, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, oatmeal, flavor is sweet with chocolate, caramel and oatmeal, medium to full bodied.

Tap @ CBC, 14. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, wood and vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla caramel, wood, medium sweet and bitter.

American Craft Beer Week! Firestone Tap Takeover at the Common Table. Poured a black with a thin khaki top and some lacing. Taste of chocolate, roasted dark malts, oak, whiskey, alcohol hidden, very complex! Medium carbonation, thick body.

Bottle pours dark drown with thin tan head. Wonderful aroma of chocolate, coffee and oatmeal. Taste doesnt match up to the aroma unfortunately, roast malts with some coffee and dark chocolate. A little oak, didnt get much bourbon at all. Finish mainly a continuation of the taste with some bitterness. Palate thin with not much of the oatmeal texturing.

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet with bourbon, sugar, cocoa. dark malt, chocolate, coconut, vanilla, 
Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is smooth, carbonation is soft+. Finishes dry and roasted with bourbon.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Re-rate 2/12/15: Draught at The Sycamore in San Francisco. Black with a tan head. Lovely aroma of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and a bit of coconut. Sweet flavor of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and a bit of coffee. Full-bodied. Very good. 8/4/7/4/15=3.8

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 2nd session. Dark brown with a beige head. Lovely aroma of cookies, vanilla, some chocolate and bourbon. Sweet flavor with cookies, nuts. Vanilla, caramel, some chocolate and bourbon. Medium to full-bodied. 8/3/7/4/15=3.7

02-MAY-2014, draft @CBC, Blue Session.
Black with lasting tan head.
Aroma is roast, wood, bourbon, chocolat. Taste the same. Sooooou smooth. So much better barrel integration than most. So wonderfull.

Bottle at Savor poured by Dave Walker. This was a WOW beer. Pitch black with aromas of chocolate and dominated by caramel. Flavor was again dominated by caramel, with chocolate and other deep roasty flavors as well. Coats the throat, a desert in a bottle.

Draught at CBC 2014.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and dark chocolate.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel and dark chocolate.
Roasted finish.
At CBC. Balck colour with tan head. Vanilla, wood aroma. Wood, sweet, vanilla and roasted taste. Medium to full body.

Draft at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Session 2. Pours deep, black-brown with a fine, tan cream head. Dark malts in the nose with light chocolate and berry accents. Medium sweet flavor with jammy, dark berries, toffee, milk chocolate, minimal bitterness. Medium bodied with fine carbonation and oily texture. Sweet to finish, some sugary chocolate, more ripe and sugary fruits, berries. Very tasty, just a bit one-sided.
On tap at rustico, pours black with tan head. Aroma is big bourbon and roast. Taste is dominated by bourbon, roast, with a creamy finish. A bit hot and oxidized as it warms

Bottled. Pours black with an average, lacing, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon, caramel, vanilla, coconut and some coffee. Sweet flavor that ends up dry with a hint of bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A world class stout.

Draught CBC 2014. Dark brown coloured. Light brown dense head. ARoma. Chocolate, caramel, cocoa, roast, coffee, light vanilla. Flavour. Chocolate, coconut, carmel, cocoa, roast vanilla, vague berries. Medium to full bodied. Ends roasted bitter with a light sweet berrie touch. Nice.

Comes together very well. It has this velvety touch that makes for a great dry and smooth feel. Pours dark brown without much head or lacing. Oat balances out the barrel, roast isnt that evident. Some vanilla. Tap at Churchkey takeover.

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Black with a creamy tan head. Aroma and taste of chocolate, roasted malt, oak, bourbon, vanilla and some sugar. The mouthfeel was smooth. A nicely drinkable stout.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Copenhagen, session 2. Pitch black beer with a lasting beige head. Roasted chocolate and caramel aroma, raisins, cocoa, woody, vanilla, nutcreme, figs, dades. Chocolate flavor, caramel, nuts, licorice, woody, cocoa, vanilla, some cream, some licorice. Full bodied and with good balance. Alcohol is well hidden. Really good!
Great brew by Firestone walker, taste is of a nice chocolate hazelnut with a sweet bourbon background, almost like mixing whisky with Nutella. Overall an easy going but complex stout

Version 2013. Une tunique presque noire et un col a priori imposant, Un début de dentelle. Un nez simple où il fait bon respirer le bourbon vanillé et les notes chocolatées. Un goût qui ne mimpressionne pas du tout avec une eau-de-vie peu intense mais dominatrice. Dommage que les saveurs maltées souffrent de ce manque de finesse. En bouche, un corps étonnamment mince : je pensais que le 8.5% et lavoine allaient le gonfler. Une finale sans surprise sur des notes de barrique. Loin dêtre une catastrophe. Je pense simplement quelle nest pas faite pour moi.

CBC 2014. Pours black with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, honey, muscovado sugar, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is roasted malts, muscovado sugar, honey, chocolate, vanilla. Mouthfeel is smooth with low carbonation. Aftertaste is muscovado sugar, roasted malts, slight chocolate and vanilla.

2014 bottle to snifter. 
Aroma is oak, vanilla, bourbon. 
Taste is more bourbon and malt. Not as thick as I expected. 
Finish is super dry. 
Pretty nice overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ CBC 2014. Pours deep black with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has oak, vanilla, liquorice. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fine malts, liquorice, a bit thin, oak, plums. A bit thin perhaps.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Tap at the Copenhagen beer festival... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Dark malt nose... Wierd meaty malts... Something very odd 3.0
Bottle at home bottle at home dark brown ... thin tan lacing ... soft chocolate roast ... soft dark chocolate roast malt nose ... dark sweet chocolate .. big vanilla .. soft chocolate .. mellow roast malts .. 4.0

CBC 2014
Pours black low off white head
Aromas of hazelnuts, chocolate, coffee, caramel
Taste has nice milk chocolate notes mixed with hazelnuts. Wee bit light bodied

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of brown sugar, chocolate, coffee, light vanilla. Taste is sweet, smooth and chocolatey, very balanced! Body is rich and creamy smooth with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle poured into a teku. Pours thick black with a velvety head of khaki foam. The aroma is big vanilla with notes of oak, chocolate, and light coffee. The beer is really sweet and earthy. Thick mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

Pours a creamy dark brown with a nice medium brown head. The aroma hits the spot. The wood conditioning of this brew is prefectly done. Not too little not too much just perfect bourbony notes along with rich chocolate. Thers is also a clear vinous / rummy character here and just a slight herbal hint also. Great nose. The mouthfeel is rather light but the taste is still full - again with so much chocolate, barrel and roasted malt. Slightly bitter aftetaste which can sometimes be the case with these wood influenced beers. Lovely!

Appearance - 5/5 - nice brown/black beer w a mocha head that sticks for a while, leaves nice lacing too. 
S/Aroma - 10/10 - bourbon, chocolate, coffee, caramel, vanilla, cocoa, oak, smoke
T - 7/10 - bourbon/oak is huge, coffee chocolate, smoke, roasted mlats , oatmeal stands out quite bit too. 
Palate - 4/5 - medium/thick, not as thick as I was expecting, little bit of a boozy feel, aftertaste is roasted malts, coffee, oak.
O - 18/20 - smell is phenomenal, as you drink it, it thins out a lot in taste and nouthfeel. Probably due to the combo of being lower abv for this type of beer and barrel aged.

Poured from 22oz bottle. Pours black with thin beige head. Aroma is some vanilla, coconut and toasted malt. This is a bit thin. I was expecting it to be a bit more full. Taste is roasted coconut, vanilla, smoked wood and some bittersweet chocolate. I wish this was just a touch sweeter and a bit more full bodied. The flavors are there, I just think they may have blended it too much.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave, Harris and Jordan on 4/11/2014.
Appearance: Pours dark black.
Aroma: Aroma of bourbon, coffee.
Taste: Bourbon, light roast, chocolate, coffee.
Palate:Medium body, lingering aftertaste..
Summary: Thanks Harris for sharing. One of those hard to find beers Ive been wanting to try for awhile. Enjoyable.

Fizzy, active dark brown body yields foamy tan head. Some roasted and nutty malts greet my nose. 

Opens up much more boldly on the palate. Silky toffee, caramel, breads, and booze. Goes down a bit hotter than expected, quite tasty otherwise.

2013 bomber thanks to michaelinwa. Pours thick and creamy, black in color, with a nice creamy beige head that fades to a ring. Complex aroma of dark chocolate, dark roasted coffee, creamy oatmeal, vanilla, coconut, light lactose, and oak. Taste starts with chocolate milk and coffee. Turns to vanilla, coconut, and oak. Finishes with bitter chocolate, bourbon, and oatmeal. Full body with a thick, creamy and smooth mouthfeel. Nice soft, foamy carbonation. This beer feels bigger than 8.5%. Its a sipper that wont destroy you. Very good.

Bottle, picked up at a Nugget Market in Woodland, CA for $15. If only I had options like this at the local grocer back home. Pours a very dark brown with a short lived beige head. Light ring throughout. The nose is nice for the style, a light bourbon and oak blended with cocoa and roast. Very smooth and silky mouthfeel, but the flavor seems muted. Good bourbon and oak, light roast and espresso. Maybe a hint of vanilla. Seems light on the carbonation. Pretty good overall, but something about it seems subdued. Very approachable BA stout.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly black with reddish hues and a smooth creamy medium brown head. Aroma is light roasted malts, slightly nutty, and a hint of sweet chocolate. Flavor is much more chocolatey with a light oats and roasted malts. Lighter in body with a wonderful lingering chocolatey character. Delicious!

Échantillonné du Extreme beer fest 2014: Un nez décadent de vanille, caramel et chocolat qui rappel dautres bouteilles cachées dans ces fameuses boites de carton. En bouche cest assez riche et sucré mais le traitement du vieillissement en barriques prend le dessus facilement, je préfère la velvet merlin.
Bottle - Chocolate and oatmeal. Jet black with a thin beige head. Chocolate. Qaky bourbon chocolate and syrupy. These guys know how to play with barbells.

On tap at Beercraft. Pours deep brown with a rusty touch and a tan head. Deep chocolate and Sugar Daddies aroma, really sweet and inviting. Flavor follows, adding mild coconut and oak, really sublimely balanced. Incredible white russian finish. Awesome beer.

great jet black pour with a medium creamy tan head. aroma has nice bourbon without booze, vanilla, woody spice, roastiness, dark fruits. flavor follows suit...great barrel qualities without booze...just the right sweetness without going overboard. mouthfeel is medium and creamy with a roasty/barrely finish. beautiful!

On tap at the EBF Saturday
Nice thick rich stout with some nice barrel notes.

Everything about velvet merlin and make it a little bit better. The barrel accents the flavor profile wonderfully. The dark fruits and sweet breads are hit with vanilla and spice from the oak. Some dark cherry as well. great.

The appearance fuses an opaque black color with a large lightly tan head, and the aroma blends cocoa nibs, oatmeal, caramel malts, roasty malts, and vanilla. The taste is mildly bitter, mildly umami, slightly sweet, and a touch sour, which creates a really complex and pleasant flavor; furthermore, the palate complements the flavor nicely due to the flat carbonation, slick texture, full body, and long and robust finish.

2013 bottle. Very dark color, a little cherry brown around the edges when held up, foam mostly disappears except for a little blanket on the surface. Cherry bourbon infused with roast aroma, bit of cigar. Palate is quite thin and watery. It has a decent heavily roasted stout flavor with a slightly hot bourbon edge. Nice wood and ash tones in the finish. Man, palate is disappointing though and undermines the beer as a whole.
Black brown pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is chocolate, BB, fruitiness, and coffee. Flavor is sweet chocolate, vanilla, fruity, and coffee. Medium body with smooth carbonation. slick beer

Dark dark brown with a decent light brown head. Aroma is chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla. Creamy mouthfeel, smooth and velvety on the palate. Taste is chocolate, caramel, vanilla, raisins. Fantastic example of an oatmeal stout.

bottle. huge chocolate and cocoa in the nose with some slight booze. pours a dark brown with a light brown head that dissipates quickly with excellent lacing. taste is nothing short of phenomenal. a smooth and elegant silky stout with just the perfect balance of base beer and barrel. seriously, this may be better than parabola. a little thin, but it is only 8.5%. A slight tartness that detracts from the smoothness as it warms but otherwise one of the best FW beers I have had.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014

Appearance: The beer pours a deep brown to black and appears pitch black in the body. The head is short and dense, settling into a big foamy ring with a light coating.
Aroma: The aroma is phenomenal, complex and inviting. The aroma has a prominent brownie batter aroma with earthy roasted coffee matching it in strength perfectly, hints of barrel back this up providing a touch of coconut and vanilla. The aroma reminds me a bit of an Oreo cookie at times, brownie batter at others and chocolate covered espresso beans. The aroma leans sweet but not cloying.
Taste: The intro is light of roasted coffee and brownie batter that lays a mild base for the beer. Toasted coconut and sweet vanilla compliment this nicely by the finish, vanilla being rather prominent. The finish lingers and hangs on my tongue and in the back of my throat like oaky bourbon. I love the balance throughout and how restrained the flavor is. Nothing is overly bold, all of the flavors simply blend together harmoniously to give a semi-dry and complex beer.
Palate: Full-bodied, but a bit thin at times, velvety texture and mild carbonation.
Overall: This is a fantastic beer when all is said and done. This may be my second favorite Firestone Walker beer, after Parabola. The only way I could enjoy this more is if the malt base were a bit bigger and the chocolate and coffee flavors were just a bit more bold. Well done.

Taste is sweet and delicious. This is freakin dessert! A bit thinner than full bodied, mild carbonation. Delicious brew!
bomber from your moms house... pitch black pour with kacki head.. vanilla, chocolate, even some caramel, super crazy smooth for 8.5%..love i

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2013 On tap at OBriens, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of  strong bourbon notes, vanilla and hinting lots of sweetness. Flavour brings loads of bourbon, vanilla, and a little roast. Fairly sweet and very barrel-dominated. Complex, but a little too much sweetness for me. I actually prefer the easier drinking Velvet Merlin. Still, great stuff.

Foil-capped bomber in a box. 2013 bottle. Aroma is chock full of barrel-aged stout goodness, with oak, toasted coconut, chocolate, coffee, artisan caramel, light smoke, faint raisin all readily apparent. Pours inky black with a one finger tan head that collapses after a minute into a ring. Taste is even better than the aroma let on, with all aroma descriptors in even fuller force. Mouthfeel is velvety, body full. This is beer making at its finest. My favorite beers of all time are the Firestone Walker Anniversary beers, and its obvious to me now that this is one of the major components in those blends. I havent had the other beers involved in those blends by themselves in awhile, but (this is just me trying to remember) I would say that this is the backbone of those blends (at least XIV and XVI, which are my favorites so far). I cant wait for XVII in which this beer once again makes a star appearance.

You can smell the alcohol even though only 8.5% ABV, sweet smell, smooth taste, the taste isnt strong, very good CO2, but basically no aftertaste, its swallow and its over. Good but not close to Parabla.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Taproom, jet black, thin head, slight bourbon aroma, coconut finish.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2013 Pours chocolate black with a nice tan head. The aroma is amazing. Chocolate, coffee, milk, and burbon. The taste is initially amazing. Strong bourbon and woody chocolate. It almost immediately falls flat though. This beer is so light and thin tasting. I expected a rich thick beer from the smell and it ended up being light. The mouthfeel is full because of the oatmeal. Its good, just not my favorite from them.

2013 vintage, 22 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a dark brown/black body that lets just a bit of light through. Large head of wispy khaki foam. Aroma is milk chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, oak, and loads of coconut. Smells like the best cookie ever. Taste is similar with chocolate brownies and roast accompanied by that distinctive Firestone Walker coconut/vanilla decadence. Flavor dissipates quickly. Thin mouthfeel, but then again it?s an 8% BA milk stout. Alcohol is very well masked but the bourbon barrel pulls through strong. Insanely delicious beer and just a notch below Parabola. This drinks far too easily.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served with slight, ruby highlighting showing through the dark, black/brown color, a silky, brownish tan layer of head foam, and a doily-like band of clingy lacing. The nose was very roasty, with creaminess to the rich chocolate notes, only a touch of coffee, a bit of woodiness, and hints of tart, dark cherry. The taste exposed more, as moderate hop bitterness, subtle bourbon & alcohol warmth, and light, barrel influenced vanilla. Medium+ bodied and very smooth. Barreling only upgraded this already fine brew to another tasty level.

2013 bottle.
Aroma is fairly chocolate forward with a moderately strong oatmeal note. Medium light vanilla and bourbon notes with a hint of oak. Faint fruitiness with a light toffee and caramel character. 
Pours a very dark opaque brown, almost black with a moderately thick tan head with pretty good retention. Light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is also fairly oat forward and sweet with a moderate chocolate note and lighter caramel and toffee. Bourbon and oak are light but vanilla is moderate. Medium light bitterness and no hop flavor.
Mouthfeel is medium to medium light bodied with moderate carbonation; its honestly thinner than I expected. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth.
Overall a good stout, but I was left expecting a bit more mouthfeel. The oat quality and vanilla from the barrels is very apparent, but the bourbon character is a little light for my tastes. This is not a beer I would cellar as I feel its at its peak.

Batch 1 of bottled version. Just not a great beer for barrel aging or not a great effort. Nose has plenty of nice vanilla, oak, and coconut notes which gets better as it warms. The taste is really nothing special with the nose notes falling flat. Terribly thin but so is the non BA version. It's an oatmeal stout and all. All and all I would have to rate this as fairly substandard.

From a 22 ounce bottle. Chocolate. Light body. Creamy. Slight nutty taste. Nice even if not a big barrel beer.

Firestone Walker is not capable of making a bad beer and in fact they only make good beers. If its a beer that is meant to be to style they will follow it to the T. If it is a hybrid they are willing to go nuts with it.

 Velvet Merkin has a good story behind it and is made with so much love and care you can taste it. I am overwhelmed by the thick dark toasted presence of this beer. Some toasted coconut is present with also a nice roasted tobacco. Some alcohol warmth but nothing as compared to their other specialty beers, This is the zenith that all beer should try to achieve. If have not had this yet, try and find a bottle to drink now and bottle to cellar.

On tap at FIrestone Walker in Paso Robles! Great taproom! Nice tan head with fair lacing. Color is opaque black. Aroma is heavily of vanilla and bourbon. Maple and brown sugar is also present. Taste is a bit different from the aroma. Sweet bourbon and earthy coffee is what I get at the front, toasty oats and charred oak on the tail end. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light for an aged stout. Creamy, and a great finish. Wonderful beer!

2013 bottle, opened 10/3/13. Black, with a reddish hue. Milk chocolate thick head. Bourbon, and roast chocolate are very smooth on the nose. Very thick, smooth mouthfeel. Notes of bourbon, oats, chocolate and light coffee. Very good, and not overwhelming, but I typically prefer my BA stouts bigger

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2014 Pours black with a light tan head. Alcohol, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, wood and roasted malt aroma. Creamy chocolate, cocoa, coffee, bourbon, wood and roasted malt flavors. Full creamy body and a creamy chocolate and wood finish. 13, 14

22oz bottle via trade. pours a deep, dark brown that sits black in the glass capped by a creamy, light khaki head that leaves heavy sheets of lace. aroma is outstanding with notes of dry oatmeal, brown sugar, chocolate chips, vanilla, and toast backed by subtle hints of dark fruits, bourbon, and oak. flavor absolutely wonderful with rich, dark, bakers chocolate, cherry cordials, toasted coconut, vanilla, and brown sugar oatmeal backed by toasted barrel, raisin bread, and bourbon. palate is medium bodied, smooth as silk, and dangerously drinkable. overall, another well done barrel aged brew from FW.
Bomber. Nice dark brown pour. Dark chocolate and a bit of coffee. Not super complicated but very good.

Black with little head. Nice oatmeal aroma. Very potent oatmeal flavor along with licorice and vanilla and some oaky charcoal whisky taste. This is very complex but stil the oatmealiest tastin oatmeal stout Ive had by a mile. Its almost like its "dry hopped" with oats.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Re-rate for 2015:  huge bourbon/oak, chocolate aroma.  Flavor is huge mounds bar, oatmeal raisin cookie, orange liqueur, light roast coffee. Slick, creamy mouthfeel.  Very decadent for abv and the body is much fuller and rounder than the prior vintage.

Chocolate, vanilla, coffee goodness packed in a fantastic package of an oatmeal stout. Thick, rich and flavorful. Almost no head, but good lacing due to the 10w30 thickness!

Wow, from the first whiff you know this is going to be interesting. Milk chocolate aroma, moderate head retention and lacing accent this stout. Smooth, silky sip is followed by more chocolate flavors, with a little bit of alcohol on the finish.

---Cheers until next time!
DMSR

Well, this beer was underwhelming. The nose was nice, with some vanilla, nougat, some oats. Flavor was a nice barrel character, a little dry cocoa. The mouth is too dry honestly, and thats the biggest turn off here. A meh beer. Ive got a couple more bottles, probably just gonna sell them next year.

Bomber in a box. Pours blacker than midnight in a moonless night (thats pretty dark). Swirls up a beautiful tan head with serious lacing. Aroma is incredible -- bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coffee. Taste gives you the complex bourbon flavors but without a strong booze kick/burn -- impressive and a welcome change. I do not have a ton of experience with barrel-aged stouts, but I feel pretty safe saying this is a very good one.

We kicked the keg at Choice City in Fort Collins. The aroma is coconut, vanilla, chocolate, raisin, caramel. The flavor is vanilla, coconut, chocolate, fruity alcohol. Very drinkable, warming, well balanced. This is an amazing barrel aged beer, fantastic balance. Thanks to my wife.

On tap at Huss Brewing. Flat black color with a uniform tan head. Lovely aroma of sweet bourbon, moderate charred oak, chocolate, light coffee, vanilla, and slight molasses. Intriguing first taste of lighter bourbon than the nose suggests, sour mash with a slight vinegar tone, a touch of anise, and earthy bitterroot. The oatmeal seems to create an odd, dry, slight solvent-like finish. Relatively light body. Overall, a good BA stout, but that odd finish keeps it from reaching the same stellar status as its Proprietors Reserve Series brethren. Its simply not as awesome as I recall.

This beer has the best aroma of any I have encountered. It is surprisingly light bodied, and does not carry a bold flavor. There are wonderful barrel and bourbon flavors mixed with a light bodied roasty stout. This beer is very sweet, but not in a traditional way. I was disappointed in the ABV, as a barrel aged beer coming from FW I expected it in the double digits. It is highly drinkable, and the aroma keeps me coming back for more.

Draft at Choice City (GABF weekend). Ok, stout?? not imperial?? I thought this was very good and for the abv the booze was very prevalent. Bourbon is heavier in the nose but still in the booming in the taste. Vanilla, cocoa, milky, big roasted.

I bought this at my local bevmo because the sales associate told me about it. So glad he did. The flavor and aroma of this beer is outstanding. The taste and appearance of this poured into the glass is like anything I have tasted. If you can find it I suggest buy it. Tottaly worth the 14.99 price

On tap at Falling Rock. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy beige head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is chocolate, roast, and oak. Slick mouthfeel with strong milk chocolate flavor and light nuts with lingering sweet finish. Really enjoyed this one.

22floz/650ml bottle into a tulip glass; served cool.

Aroma: Chocolate, almost chocolate chip cookies even. Espresso. Boozy.

Appearance: Opaque dark mahogany body with a mild, creamy, dark tan head. Thick lacing.

Taste: Really chocolatey. Definitely some vanilla. Cookies.

Palate: Rich, full body. Gentle carbonation. Moderate finish.

Overall: Mmmmmmmmmmmm cookies. I swear to god this tastes like cookies a little bit. Or brownies. So great!

Mild aromatics of bourbon, vanilla and oak. Taste if coconut, vanilla and maybe some dark fruit. Good beer. 

Leave your pretensions at the door.

I really enjoyed this beer. Just had it last night at a friends house. It is very dark, so at first I wasnt sure if I would like it. Turns out it is delicious! This is a very creamy beer. My best description for it would be a dessert beer.

Dark mahogany pour with hints of chestnut, crimson, and onyx throughout the beers body. Thick latte head. Aroma shows bourbon, vanilla, oak, brownie batter, and freshly brewed Starbucks. Flavor possesses loads of Hersheys milk chocolate, marshmallow, split vanilla bean, and a splash of bourbon. What I would imagine a hot cocoa covered in heavy whipping cream and dowsed with Makers Mark would taste like. Good but the style isnt terribly conducive to barrel treatments. Velvety texture. Didnt really get the coconut or cherry skin. Will just have to drink another bottle!
Very dark pour with caramel colored head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Flavor has notes of bourbon and vanilla

Aroma really hints at the oak and the bourbon. Flavour also highlights the vanilla qualities of oak and the bourbon without being over powering. Really a great beer. I found it a Nugget 	for $15.99. The oatmeal doesnt add its usual velvetyness like it does in velvet merlin however still a delicious beer but I think the bourbon overpowers the oatmeal.

22oz bottle from Binnys St. Charles. Pours a deep, dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, some light coffee. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, roasty, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, some coffee, some light oak, with a sweet, light bourbon finish. For not being an imperial stout, this beer stood up well to the barrel. Great bourbon flavor, and very drinkable at 8.5%.

On tap @ Hungry Monk in AZ. Pours dark black with a decent mocha head. Aroma is roasted coffee, oatmeal, milk chocolate, caramel, oak and faint dark fruit. Taste is roasted coffee, milk chocolate fading into oak and caramel finish. Well balanced, good carbonation with a creamy medium body. Great winter warmer!

651mL thanks to Biggirlpanties. Clear deep red pour with weaker tan foam. Spotty lace. Nose is thicker tomato paste, hazelnut chocolate ice cream, pistachio, soy, umami savory. Taste is sweeter, thinner, sugary, a bit cloying. Palate seems thin for abv. 8.5 seems too high for Stout.

Dark chocolate aromas with a bourbon coating. A black so dark light has no affect. The flavor is everything i loved about the velvet Merlin a deliciously smooth oatmeal stout, but then it explodes with flavor of barrel, dark cherry, push, fades with a vanilla whiskey finish. Amazing.

Boys and girls, this is barrel aging done right. First off, a superb stout. I'm getting a lot of coconut here, along with other flavors in a melodiously complex symphony. The barrel aging is over the top, imbuing everything with just the right note of whiskey. Not boozey. Solid A.
